message.content:
cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.LG, cs.SY, cs.DM. 

The paper deals with the synthesis of Boolean functions to model complex behaviours in finite discrete dynamical systems, which is a problem that falls under the scope of artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG). The use of Answer-Set Programming to solve the Boolean satisfiability problem suggests that the paper could also be classified under the sub-category of logic in computer science (cs.LO). The biological context of the problem and the focus on dynamical properties of the resulting network suggest that the paper could also be classified under the sub-categories of systems and control (cs.SY) and computational biology (cs.CB). Finally, the use of random networks with scale-free structures suggests that the paper could also be classified under the sub-category of discrete mathematics (cs.DM).
